name: Colusa Grass
overview: resemble tiny ears of corn. Produces aquativ seedlings remain dormant 3-4 years, germinate during spring, flower in summer. Fruit as grains covered in gluey secretion/exudate, and when plant is mature each clump become brown and sticky with exudate. Federal list of threatened species possessing or killing is prohibited.
habitat: Found growing in alkaline basis of Sacramento and San Joaquin. Also, acidic soil along eastern San Joaquin Valley and Sierra Nevada foothills. Threatened due to habitat loss cause by algaculture and development..
tags:
